   A) Electroencephalography (EEG)
   B) Pulse oximetry
   C) Capnography
   D) Central venous pressure monitoring

162. Which drug is considered the first-line treatment for severe bradycardia during anesthesia?
   A) Atropine
   B) Amiodarone
   C) Epinephrine
   D) Lidocaine

163. Which position is commonly used for performing spinal anesthesia in a patient undergoing a cesarean section?
   A) Supine position
   B) Left lateral decubitus position
   C) Sitting position
   D) Reverse Trendelenburg position

164. What is the initial treatment for a suspected venous air embolism during surgery?
   A) Administering epinephrine
   B) Placing the patient in Trendelenburg position
   C) Initiating rapid fluid resuscitation
   D) Applying positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP)

165. Which of the following medications is most appropriate to treat postoperative shivering?
   A) Ondansetron
   B) Meperidine
   C) Propofol
   D) Ketamine

166. What is the most appropriate strategy to prevent intraoperative awareness in patients at high risk for recall during anesthesia?
   A) Use higher doses of muscle relaxants
   B) Administer benzodiazepines preoperatively
   C) Utilize bispectral index monitoring and adjust anesthetic depth accordingly
   D) Provide preoperative counseling to minimize anxiety

167. Which regional anesthesia technique is most commonly used for postoperative pain control following total knee arthroplasty?
   A) Femoral nerve block
   B) Brachial plexus block
   C) Transversus abdominis plane (TAP) block
   D) Epidural anesthesia

168. Which of the following techniques is most appropriate for managing a patient with a known difficult airway undergoing general anesthesia?
   A) Blind orotracheal intubation
   B) Video laryngoscopy
   C) Routine direct laryngoscopy
   D) Supraglottic airway insertion

169. Which neuromuscular blocking agent is preferred for rapid sequence induction in a patient at risk of aspiration?
   A) Vecuronium
   B) Rocuronium
   C) Atracurium
   D) Cisatracurium

170. Which nerve is targeted during an interscalene block to provide anesthesia for shoulder surgery?
   A) Sciatic nerve
   B) Brachial plexus
   C) Femoral nerve
   D) Axillary nerve

171. Which of the following is the most effective method to reduce preoperative anxiety in pediatric patients undergoing surgery?
   A) Premedication with midazolam
   B) Allowing parental presence during induction
   C) Using flavored masks for inhalational induction
   D) All of the above

172. During spinal anesthesia, a patient develops a sudden and severe headache that worsens when sitting up. What is the most likely cause?
   A) Intracranial hemorrhage
   B) Post-dural puncture headache
   C) Hypovolemia
   D) Meningitis

173. Which of the following is the preferred anesthetic technique for a patient undergoing an emergency cesarean delivery who has a full stomach?
   A) Spinal anesthesia
   B) Epidural anesthesia
   C) General anesthesia with rapid sequence induction
   D) Combined spinal-epidural anesthesia

174. During cardiac surgery, which monitoring device is essential for assessing myocardial ischemia?
   A) Pulse oximeter
   B) Intra-arterial blood pressure monitor
   C) Transesophageal echocardiography (TEE)
   D) Capnograph

175. What is the primary function of the scavenging system in the anesthesia machine?
   A) Deliver oxygen to the patient
   B) Prevent excessive pressure in the breathing circuit
   C) Eliminate waste anesthetic gases
   D) Measure expired carbon dioxide levels

176. Which of the following anesthetic agents is most suited for use during neurosurgery to optimize brain relaxation?
   A) Sevoflurane
   B) Isoflurane
   C) Propofol
   D) Nitrous oxide

177. Which multimodal analgesic regimen is most effective in reducing opioid consumption after major abdominal surgery?
   A) Acetaminophen and ketorolac
   B) Morphine and midazolam
   C) Gabapentin and acetaminophen
   D) Acetaminophen and fentanyl

178. Which intravenous fluid is most appropriate for a patient with significant blood loss during surgery?
   A) Normal saline
   B) Lactated Ringer’s solution
   C) 5% dextrose in water
   D) Albumin

179. Which of the following inhalational agents has the lowest blood-gas partition coefficient, leading to rapid induction and recovery?
   A) Isoflurane
   B) Sevoflurane
   C) Desflurane
   D) Halothane

180. What is the primary advantage of an ultrasound-guided nerve block over traditional landmark-based techniques?
   A) Shortened onset time
   B) Reduced risk of systemic toxicity
   C) Direct visualization of nerve structures
   D) Lower cost and equipment requirements

181. What is the primary purpose of capnography during anesthesia?
   A) Detect hypoxia
   B) Measure oxygen concentration
   C) Monitor ventilation and carbon dioxide levels
   D) Assess blood pressure continuously

182. In the event of an acute bronchospasm during surgery, which of the following interventions should be performed first?
   A) Administer intravenous corticosteroids
   B) Increase oxygen concentration and administer albuterol
   C) Perform endotracheal intubation
   D) Start a continuous infusion of epinephrine

183. During a preoperative evaluation, a patient is found to have an allergy to eggs. Which of the following anesthetic agents should be avoided?
   A) Propofol
   B) Etomidate
   C) Ketamine
   D) Thiopental

184. Which of the following is the most common complication during induction of pediatric anesthesia?
   A) Hypotension
   B) Laryngospasm
   C) Bradycardia
   D) Aspiration

185. For outpatient surgery, which of the following anesthetic techniques minimizes postoperative drowsiness and allows faster discharge?
   A) Total intravenous anesthesia (TIVA) with propofol and remifentanil
   B) General anesthesia with isoflurane
   C) Balanced anesthesia with halothane
   D) Spinal anesthesia with bupivacaine

186. Which of the following is the most effective intervention for managing increased intracranial pressure during surgery?
   A) Administer a muscle relaxant
   B) Infuse hypertonic saline or mannitol
   C) Increase the inspired oxygen concentration
   D) Administer high doses of opioids

187. During a preoperative check, you notice a sudden increase in the pressure within the anesthesia circuit. What is the most likely cause?
   A) A kink in the endotracheal tube.
   B) A disconnected oxygen supply.
   C) A malfunctioning scavenging system.
   D) Expired volatile anesthetic.

188. Which medication is most appropriate to administer for rapid reversal of opioid-induced respiratory depression during surgery?
   A) Naloxone.
   B) Flumazenil.
   C) Ondansetron.
   D) Dexmedetomidine.

189. You are managing a patient with a history of severe obstructive sleep apnea for elective surgery. What is the best strategy for extubation?
   A) Extubate immediately after the return of spontaneous ventilation.
   B) Delay extubation until the patient is fully awake and can maintain their airway.
   C) Perform a deep extubation under anesthesia.
   D) Extubate during light sedation to maintain airway reflexes.

190. A patient develops an acute hypertensive crisis during surgery. Which of the following medications would be the most appropriate to administer?
   A) Epinephrine.
   B) Sodium nitroprusside.
   C) Atropine.
   D) Furosemide.

191. Which nerve is primarily targeted during a femoral nerve block for lower extremity surgery?
   A) Sciatic nerve.
   B) Obturator nerve.
   C) Femoral nerve.
   D) Tibial nerve.

192. A patient with a history of asthma is scheduled for surgery. Which preoperative medication should be considered to reduce the risk of bronchospasm during anesthesia?
   A) Beta-blockers.
   B) Inhaled corticosteroids.
   C) Anticholinergics.
   D) Inhaled bronchodilators.

193. Which intervention is most effective for managing postoperative delirium in an elderly patient?
   A) Administering benzodiazepines.
   B) Providing adequate hydration and pain control.
   C) Increasing sedative medications to calm the patient.
   D) Immediate use of antipsychotic medications.

194. Which of the following medications is classified as an NMDA receptor antagonist and is used for analgesia during surgery?
   A) Ketamine.
   B) Propofol.
   C) Rocuronium.
   D) Midazolam.

195. Which monitoring modality is used to measure the concentration of volatile anesthetics in the anesthesia circuit?
   A) Pulse oximetry.
   B) Capnography.
   C) Gas analyzer.
   D) Bispectral index monitoring.

196. During spinal anesthesia, a patient complains of nausea and difficulty breathing. What is the most likely cause?
   A) Hypoglycemia.
   B) High spinal block.
   C) Allergic reaction to the anesthetic.
   D) Postdural puncture headache.

197. Which regional anesthesia technique provides optimal pain relief for patients undergoing hip replacement surgery?
   A) Interscalene block.
   B) Axillary block.
   C) Lumbar plexus block.
   D) Popliteal block.

198. Which of the following inhalational agents is preferred for a patient with asthma due to its bronchodilatory effects?
   A) Isoflurane.
   B) Desflurane.
   C) Sevoflurane.
   D) Nitrous oxide.

199. To minimize the risk of aspiration during induction of anesthesia, which of the following techniques should be employed in a patient with a full stomach?
   A) Slow titration of anesthetic agents.
   B) Rapid sequence induction.
   C) Awake intubation.
   D) Use of a laryngeal mask airway.

200. A patient develops malignant hyperthermia during surgery. Which of the following interventions should be performed immediately?
   A) Administer dantrolene.
   B) Increase the concentration of volatile anesthetic.
   C) Perform a rapid sequence induction.
   D) Administer atropine.

201. When calculating anesthesia billing time, which of the following must be included in the documentation?
   A) Time of incision.
   B) Time patient enters the OR.
   C) Total anesthesia time from preparation until handoff.
   D) Duration of surgical procedure only.

202. Which technique is most appropriate to manage a patient with a suspected difficult airway and cervical spine instability?
   A) Standard laryngoscopy.
   B) Fiberoptic intubation.
   C) Use of a supraglottic airway.
   D) Cricothyroidotomy.

203. A patient undergoing bariatric surgery develops hypoxemia despite adequate oxygen supplementation. What is the most likely cause?
   A) Hypoventilation.
   B) Pulmonary embolism.
   C) Bronchospasm.
   D) Atelectasis.

204. Which of the following is the primary parameter monitored using pulse oximetry during anesthesia?
   A) Heart rate.
   B) Blood oxygen saturation.
   C) Respiratory rate.
   D) Blood pressure.

205. Which of the following local anesthetics has the longest duration of action for peripheral nerve blocks?
   A) Lidocaine.
   B) Mepivacaine.
   C) Bupivacaine.
   D) Prilocaine.

206. During a laparoscopic procedure, a patient develops sudden bradycardia. Which is the most likely cause?
   A) Pneumothorax.
   B) Vagal stimulation due to peritoneal insufflation.
   C) Hyperthermia.
   D) Hypovolemia.

207. During induction, a patient with a known history of sleep apnea exhibits difficulty in maintaining oxygen saturation despite supplemental oxygen. What is the most appropriate next step?
   A) Perform a rapid sequence intubation
   B) Initiate bag-mask ventilation
   C) Insert an oropharyngeal airway
   D) Administer naloxone to counteract sedation

208. Which intravenous anesthetic is preferred for induction in a hemodynamically unstable patient due to its minimal cardiovascular effects?
   A) Propofol
   B) Etomidate
   C) Ketamine
   D) Thiopental

209. Which regional anesthesia technique is most appropriate for postoperative pain control following a total knee replacement?
   A) Femoral nerve block
   B) Interscalene block
   C) Axillary nerve block
   D) Caudal epidural block

210. What is the first-line treatment for laryngospasm during anesthesia?
   A) Administer epinephrine
   B) Apply positive pressure ventilation
   C) Deepen anesthesia with propofol
   D) Administer atropine

211. Which parameter is most accurately monitored using an arterial blood gas during anesthesia?
   A) Cerebral perfusion
   B) Hemoglobin saturation
   C) Partial pressure of carbon dioxide
   D) Heart rate

212. Which preoperative assessment tool is most effective for evaluating a patient's risk of postoperative pulmonary complications?
   A) Pulmonary function test
   B) Chest X-ray
   C) Revised Cardiac Risk Index
   D) STOP-BANG questionnaire

213. Which induction technique is most suitable for a pediatric patient with high levels of anxiety?
   A) Preoperative sedation with midazolam
   B) Rapid sequence induction with thiopental
   C) Mask induction with sevoflurane
   D) Intramuscular ketamine induction

214. Which adjunct medication is used in combination with local anesthetics to prolong the duration of a nerve block?
   A) Epinephrine
   B) Naloxone
   C) Ketorolac
   D) Dexamethasone

215. Which aspect of the anesthesia machine should be checked immediately if there is a sudden drop in oxygen concentration during surgery?
   A) Suction apparatus
   B) Vaporizer settings
   C) Oxygen supply pressure
   D) Scavenging system

216. A patient develops severe postoperative nausea and vomiting after general anesthesia. Which antiemetic is most commonly utilized to treat this condition?
   A) Ondansetron
   B) Metoclopramide
   C) Promethazine
   D) Droperidol

217. What is the most effective method for confirming proper placement of a supraglottic airway device?
   A) Chest rise during ventilation
   B) Capnography waveform analysis
   C) Auscultation of breath sounds
   D) Colorimetric CO2 detection

218. Which of the following local anesthetics is most appropriate for short procedures requiring rapid onset and intermediate duration?
   A) Bupivacaine
   B) Lidocaine
   C) Tetracaine
   D) Ropivacaine

219. During a popliteal block, which nerve is primarily targeted for anesthesia of the lower leg?
   A) Femoral nerve
   B) Sciatic nerve
   C) Obturator nerve
   D) Saphenous nerve

220. Which of the following strategies is most effective in preventing wrong-site surgery during anesthetic preparation?
   A) Double-checking the surgical site with the patient
   B) Using a standardized checklist
   C) Marking the surgical site with a permanent marker
   D) Having the surgeon confirm the site after induction

221. Which of the following is the preferred technique for anesthesia in a patient undergoing carotid endarterectomy?
   A) General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation
   B) Regional anesthesia with cervical plexus block
   C) Peripheral nerve block with an axillary approach
   D) Monitored anesthesia care with sedation

222. Which of the following is a benefit of using a transversus abdominis plane (TAP) block in abdominal surgeries?
   A) Reduction in the need for general anesthesia
   B) Improved control of visceral pain
   C) Decreased opioid consumption postoperatively
   D) Prevention of intraoperative awareness

223. During a suspected anaphylactic reaction to anesthetic drugs, which medication should be administered immediately?
   A) Antihistamines
   B) Epinephrine
   C) Corticosteroids
   D) Bronchodilators

224. Which inhalational anesthetic agent is associated with the fastest recovery due to low blood solubility?
   A) Sevoflurane
   B) Halothane
   C) Isoflurane
   D) Desflurane

225. Which anesthetic agent is associated with the lowest incidence of emergence delirium in children?
   A) Sevoflurane
   B) Ketamine
   C) Propofol
   D) Isoflurane

226. A patient with a history of uncontrolled hypertension is scheduled for surgery. Which preoperative intervention is crucial to reduce the risk of intraoperative complications?
   A) Administer a diuretic
   B) Ensure blood pressure control before surgery
   C) Provide intravenous fluid resuscitation
   D) Start beta-blocker therapy immediately

227. Which parameter should be closely monitored in a patient receiving opioid analgesics postoperatively?
   A) Heart rate
   B) Oxygen saturation
   C) Urine output
   D) Blood glucose levels

228. A patient undergoing surgery requires general anesthesia. The anesthesiologist opts to use a rapid sequence induction (RSI). Which of the following steps is critical during RSI?
   A) Administering high-dose opioids before induction.
   B) Avoiding the use of muscle relaxants.
   C) Applying cricoid pressure during intubation.
   D) Using volatile anesthetics immediately after induction.

229. Which of the following medications is commonly administered to prevent bradycardia during anesthesia involving the use of succinylcholine?
   A) Atropine
   B) Ketamine
   C) Fentanyl
   D) Epinephrine

230. During anesthesia, a patient exhibits hypercapnia. Which of the following is the most likely cause?
   A) High tidal volume on the ventilator.
   B) Insufficient alveolar ventilation.
   C) Low inhaled oxygen concentration.
   D) Excessive use of volatile anesthetics.

231. Which of the following interventions is most suitable for a patient undergoing craniotomy to manage increased intracranial pressure?
   A) Administering high-flow oxygen.
   B) Using mannitol as an osmotic diuretic.
   C) Increasing the depth of anesthesia with propofol.
   D) Performing a spinal tap to decrease cerebrospinal fluid.

232. Which of the following nerve blocks is most appropriate for anesthesia during hand surgery?
   A) Axillary nerve block
   B) Interscalene block
   C) Supraclavicular block
   D) Brachial plexus block

233. A patient undergoing general anesthesia develops sudden hypotension and tachycardia. Which of the following conditions is the most likely cause?
   A) Malignant hyperthermia
   B) Anaphylactic shock
   C) Pneumothorax
   D) Pulmonary embolism

234. Which technique is most effective for confirming endotracheal tube placement during intubation under general anesthesia?
   A) Chest auscultation
   B) Capnography
   C) Pulse oximetry
   D) Visual inspection

235. Which preoperative medication is recommended to reduce anxiety in pediatric patients undergoing general anesthesia?
   A) Lorazepam
   B) Midazolam
   C) Haloperidol
   D) Diazepam

236. During cardiac surgery, which anesthetic agent is preferred for myocardial protection due to its ability to reduce oxygen consumption?
   A) Propofol
   B) Sevoflurane
   C) Nitrous Oxide
   D) Ketamine

237. During labor, an epidural is administered to a pregnant patient. Which of the following complications is most commonly associated with epidural anesthesia?
   A) Seizures
   B) Hypotension
   C) Allergic reaction
   D) Hemorrhage

238. In elderly patients undergoing surgery, which anesthetic consideration is most critical for minimizing cognitive dysfunction postoperatively?
   A) Avoiding benzodiazepines
   B) Using higher doses of opioids
   C) Administering preoperative antibiotics
   D) Reducing surgery duration

239. Which medication is considered the drug of choice for preventing postoperative nausea and vomiting in high-risk patients?
   A) Ondansetron
   B) Diphenhydramine
   C) Metoclopramide
   D) Atropine

240. Which regional anesthesia technique is most effective for managing postoperative pain following total knee arthroplasty?
   A) Adductor canal block
   B) Intercostal nerve block
   C) Paravertebral nerve block
   D) Epidural anesthesia

241. Which hemodynamic parameter is most accurately measured using a pulmonary artery catheter during anesthesia?
   A) Central venous pressure
   B) Cardiac output
   C) Pulmonary vascular resistance
   D) Systemic vascular resistance

242. What is the most effective intervention for managing airway bleeding during intubation?
   A) Increasing oxygen flow rate
   B) Suctioning the airway
   C) Administering epinephrine
   D) Switching to a nasal cannula

243. A patient undergoing shoulder surgery is scheduled to receive an interscalene block. Which of the following complications should be most closely monitored?
   A) Hemothorax
   B) Neuropathy
   C) Diaphragmatic paralysis
   D) Hypotension

244. A patient develops tachycardia and increased end-tidal CO2 during general anesthesia. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
   A) Malignant hyperthermia
   B) Pulmonary embolism
   C) Anaphylaxis
   D) Acute myocardial infarction

245. Which of the following components of the anesthesia machine is responsible for removing exhaled carbon dioxide?
   A) Vaporizer
   B) Spirometer
   C) CO2 absorber
   D) Ventilator bellows

246. During a preoperative evaluation, a patient mentions a history of malignant hyperthermia in a close relative. What is the most appropriate action?
   A) Use succinylcholine with caution.
   B) Administer dantrolene prophylactically.
   C) Avoid general anesthesia and use regional anesthesia instead.
   D) Perform genetic testing for malignant hyperthermia susceptibility.

247. What is the most appropriate intervention for a patient with delayed emergence from anesthesia?
   A) Administering flumazenil
   B) Performing a CT scan
   C) Administering naloxone
   D) Reassessing oxygenation and ventilation

248. During a routine surgery, the patient develops cyanosis and desaturation. What is the immediate next step?
   A) Administer epinephrine
   B) Increase oxygen delivery
   C) Perform a needle decompression
   D) Start chest compressions

249. When documenting anesthesia time for billing purposes, which of the following describes the correct start time?
   A) The time the patient enters the operating room
   B) The time the anesthesiologist begins preparing the patient for anesthesia induction
   C) The time the patient's surgical incision is made
   D) The time the anesthesiologist administers the first anesthetic dose

250. A patient under spinal anesthesia develops a sudden drop in blood pressure. What is the most likely cause?
   A) Hypovolemia
   B) Sympathetic blockade
   C) Vasovagal response
   D) Allergic reaction to the anesthetic

251. What is the preferred method for delivering anesthesia to a pediatric patient undergoing a tonsillectomy?
   A) Intravenous induction with propofol
   B) Inhalational induction with sevoflurane
   C) Epidural anesthesia
   D) Spinal anesthesia

252. During a surgical procedure, the anesthesiologist suspects a leak in the endotracheal tube. Which of the following is the most appropriate intervention?
   A) Increase the tidal volume
   B) Perform a cuff pressure check and reinflate if necessary
   C) Replace the anesthesia machine circuit
   D) Administer muscle relaxants

253. A patient with a history of obstructive sleep apnea is scheduled for general anesthesia. Which preoperative action is most crucial?
   A) Administer a high dose of opioids for pain management
   B) Ensure availability of CPAP or BiPAP in the postoperative period
   C) Avoid preoperative fasting to prevent hypoglycemia
   D) Administer benzodiazepines for anxiety relief

254. Which of the following anesthetic agents is most appropriate for a patient with a history of epilepsy undergoing surgery?
   A) Ketamine
   B) Etomidate
   C) Propofol
   D) Thiopental

255. During a femoral nerve block, which anatomical landmark is most commonly used for accurate needle placement?
   A) Femoral artery
   B) Saphenous vein
   C) Popliteal artery
   D) Greater trochanter

256. A patient complains of severe headache after undergoing spinal anesthesia. What is the most likely cause?
   A) Nerve root irritation
   B) Post-dural puncture headache
   C) Hypovolemia
   D) Allergic reaction to anesthetic

257. Which of the following is the most reliable method for detecting unintentional esophageal intubation?
   A) Pulse oximetry
   B) Capnography
   C) Observation of chest rise
   D) Auscultation of breath sounds

258. Which maneuver is most effective in preventing regurgitation during mask ventilation?
   A) Head-tilt chin-lift
   B) Cricoid pressure
   C) Jaw thrust
   D) Use of an oropharyngeal airway

259. What is the most appropriate intervention for a pediatric patient who develops bradycardia during induction with sevoflurane?
   A) Administer atropine
   B) Increase the concentration of sevoflurane
   C) Provide verbal reassurance to the patient
   D) Switch to intravenous induction

260. Which of the following is the most appropriate method to manage airway obstruction caused by tongue prolapse during sedation?
   A) Apply jaw thrust
   B) Increase sedation level
   C) Administer muscle relaxant
   D) Perform tracheostomy

261. What is the first step in troubleshooting a ventilator alarm indicating low tidal volume delivery?
   A) Replace the ventilator
   B) Check for leaks in the circuit
   C) Increase the ventilator setting
   D) Administer additional oxygen

262. A diabetic patient is scheduled for surgery under general anesthesia. Which preoperative action should be taken to minimize complications?
   A) Increase the patient's insulin dose
   B) Monitor blood glucose and avoid hypoglycemia
   C) Administer a diuretic to prevent fluid retention
   D) Withhold all antidiabetic medications the day before surgery

263. During surgery, a patient experiences respiratory distress and decreased oxygen saturation. Which immediate action should the anesthesiologist take?
   A) Administer muscle relaxants
   B) Increase oxygen flow and check airway patency
   C) Start chest compressions
   D) Administer epinephrine

264. Which of the following medications is most effective in reversing the effects of neuromuscular blockade?
   A) Rocuronium
   B) Suxamethonium
   C) Neostigmine
   D) Lidocaine

265. Which of the following regional anesthesia techniques is most suitable for pain management following an ankle surgery?
   A) Interscalene block
   B) Femoral nerve block
   C) Popliteal sciatic nerve block
   D) Transversus abdominis plane (TAP) block

266. Which anesthetic agent is contraindicated in a patient with a history of acute porphyria?
   A) Propofol
   B) Halothane
   C) Etomidate
   D) Nitrous oxide

267. Which of the following is the most appropriate management for a patient experiencing postoperative shivering?
   A) Administer naloxone
   B) Increase ambient room temperature
   C) Administer meperidine
   D) Provide supplemental oxygen

268. Which preoperative medication is commonly administered to reduce gastric acidity and volume?
   A) Midazolam
   B) Metoclopramide
   C) Ranitidine
   D) Ondansetron

269. Which of the following is the most appropriate anesthetic technique for a patient undergoing cesarean delivery due to fetal distress?
   A) Spinal anesthesia
   B) Epidural anesthesia
   C) Combined spinal-epidural anesthesia
   D) General anesthesia

270. A patient with a BMI of 40 is scheduled for laparoscopic cholecystectomy under general anesthesia. What is the most critical consideration during preoperative evaluation?
   A) Assessment of airway related to obesity
   B) Routine preoperative chest X-ray
   C) Avoidance of preoperative fasting
   D) Routine administration of sedatives

271. During induction of general anesthesia, a patient presents with a sudden increase in heart rate and temperature. What is the most likely diagnosis?
   A) Anaphylaxis
   B) Malignant hyperthermia
   C) Sepsis
   D) Cardiac arrhythmia

272. Which of the following is the optimal site for injecting local anesthetic during a sciatic nerve block?
   A) Antecubital fossa
   B) Popliteal fossa
   C) Inguinal region
   D) Axillary region

273. A patient with chronic kidney disease is undergoing surgery. Which opioid is preferred for intraoperative pain management?
   A) Morphine
   B) Fentanyl
   C) Meperidine
   D) Codeine

274. Which regional anesthesia technique is least likely to cause systemic toxicity?
   A) Epidural anesthesia
   B) Spinal anesthesia
   C) Peripheral nerve block
   D) Infiltration anesthesia

275. During anesthesia, a patient develops laryngospasm leading to airway obstruction. What is the first line of management?
   A) Administer atropine
   B) Apply positive pressure ventilation
   C) Perform a tracheotomy
   D) Administer epinephrine

276. Which monitoring modality is preferred to assess the depth of anesthesia?
   A) Pulse oximetry
   B) Bispectral index (BIS)
   C) Arterial blood gas (ABG)
   D) Urine output measurement

277. A patient complains of shivering postoperatively after receiving general anesthesia. Which medication is most effective in treating postoperative shivering?
   A) Morphine
   B) Ondansetron
   C) Dexmedetomidine
   D) Meperidine

278. Which intravenous anesthetic agent is preferred for rapid induction in patients with cardiovascular instability?
   A) Propofol
   B) Thiopental
   C) Etomidate
   D) Ketamine

279. A patient with a suspected cervical spine injury requires airway management. Which technique is most appropriate?
   A) Nasotracheal intubation
   B) Orotracheal intubation with manual in-line stabilization
   C) Head-tilt chin-lift maneuver
   D) Use of a laryngeal mask airway

280. Which medication is commonly used to reverse benzodiazepine-induced sedation?
   A) Naloxone
   B) Flumazenil
   C) Physostigmine
   D) Atropine

281. Which of the following is the most appropriate anesthetic induction technique for a 4-year-old child undergoing surgery?
   A) Intravenous induction with propofol
   B) Inhalation induction with sevoflurane
   C) Rapid sequence induction with etomidate
   D) Intramuscular induction with ketamine

282. During a spinal anesthesia procedure, the patient's legs become numb, and they experience difficulty breathing. What is the most likely cause?
   A) Nerve injury
   B) High spinal block
   C) Allergic reaction to the anesthetic
   D) Vasovagal response

283. Which component of the anesthesia machine prevents the delivery of hypoxic gas mixtures?
   A) Flowmeter
   B) Oxygen flush valve
   C) Oxygen failure safety device
   D) Carbon dioxide absorber

284. A patient with severe GERD is scheduled for surgery under general anesthesia. Which preoperative medication may reduce the risk of aspiration?
   A) Metoclopramide
   B) Ondansetron
   C) Morphine
   D) Ketamine

285. During cardiac surgery, a patient requires hemodynamic stability. Which agent is commonly used for inducing anesthesia in this case?
   A) Ketamine
   B) Propofol
   C) Etomidate
   D) Thiopental

286. Which of the following agents is preferred for rapid reversal of neuromuscular blockade induced by rocuronium?
   A) Atropine
   B) Neostigmine
   C) Sugammadex
   D) Physostigmine

287. What is the most effective intervention for airway management in a patient with facial trauma and bleeding?
   A) Nasotracheal intubation
   B) Orotracheal intubation
   C) Cricothyrotomy
   D) Use of a supraglottic airway

288. Which position is commonly used during surgery to improve venous return and reduce the risk of hypotension during anesthesia?
   A) Trendelenburg position
   B) Supine position
   C) Prone position
   D) Lithotomy position

289. A patient develops stridor and difficulty breathing after extubation in the postoperative period. What is the most appropriate intervention?
   A) Administer oxygen via nasal cannula
   B) Perform emergency re-intubation
   C) Administer nebulized epinephrine
   D) Provide reassurance to the patient

290. During a general anesthesia procedure, a patient develops hypotension. Which medication is commonly administered to stabilize blood pressure?
   A) Epinephrine
   B) Phenylephrine
   C) Lidocaine
   D) Propofol

291. A patient scheduled for surgery under general anesthesia reports a history of difficult intubation. What is the most appropriate preoperative intervention?
   A) Schedule a fiberoptic intubation
   B) Administer succinylcholine
   C) Use a video laryngoscope for intubation
   D) Prepare for a surgical airway

292. Which of the following anesthesia techniques is most appropriate for a patient receiving a lower extremity amputation?
   A) Brachial plexus block
   B) Caudal epidural anesthesia
   C) Spinal anesthesia
   D) TIVA (Total Intravenous Anesthesia)

293. During intubation, a patient develops laryngospasm. What is the next immediate step?
   A) Administer succinylcholine
   B) Apply positive pressure ventilation
   C) Perform cricothyrotomy
   D) Administer propofol

294. Which intravenous opioid is preferred for patients with hemodynamic instability during surgery?
   A) Morphine
   B) Fentanyl
   C) Remifentanil
   D) Meperidine

295. What anatomical landmark is crucial for performing an ultrasound-guided axillary block?
   A) Femoral artery
   B) Brachial artery
   C) Subclavian vein
   D) Median nerve

296. A patient complains of nausea and vomiting in the recovery room after general anesthesia. Which medication is most effective for symptom management?
   A) Ondansetron
   B) Metoclopramide
   C) Diphenhydramine
   D) Midazolam

297. Which premedication is most appropriate for reducing anxiety in a pediatric patient scheduled for surgery?
   A) Ketamine
   B) Dexmedetomidine
   C) Midazolam
   D) Propofol

298. A patient develops bradycardia during spinal anesthesia. What is the first-line intervention?
   A) Administer atropine
   B) Start vasopressin infusion
   C) Increase IV fluid rate
   D) Perform chest compressions

299. Which pulse oximetry reading is considered acceptable during anesthesia to ensure adequate oxygenation?
   A) 85%
   B) 90%
   C) 94%
   D) 98%

300. Which of the following local anesthetics has the longest duration of action?
   A) Lidocaine
   B) Bupivacaine
   C) Ropivacaine
   D) Procaine

301. Which component of the anesthetic machine is responsible for maintaining constant oxygen concentration in delivered gases?
   A) Vaporizer
   B) Flowmeter
   C) Oxygen analyzer
   D) Pressure regulator

302. During cardiac surgery, which monitoring modality is essential for assessing myocardial ischemia?
   A) Pulse oximetry
   B) Echocardiography
   C) Capnography
   D) Electrocardiography (ECG)

303. What is the preferred anesthetic management for a pregnant patient undergoing emergency surgery?
   A) General anesthesia with volatile agents
   B) Spinal anesthesia
   C) Epidural anesthesia
   D) Local anesthesia only

304. During preoperative assessment of a patient with aortic stenosis, which anesthetic agent should be avoided?
   A) Etomidate
   B) Propofol
   C) Ketamine
   D) Isoflurane

305. Which opioid is most suitable for managing postoperative pain in a patient with a history of opioid addiction?
   A) Fentanyl
   B) Methadone
   C) Morphine
   D) Hydromorphone



--- CORRECT ANSWERS AND EXPLANATIONS ---

1. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 01402 is appropriate for anesthesia provided during arthroscopic procedures of the knee joint, including total knee replacement.

2. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Modifier QX indicates anesthesia services performed by a CRNA under the supervision of an anesthesiologist.

3. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Anesthesia time is calculated by subtracting the start time from the end time, resulting in 45 minutes.

4. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Modifier QK is used when the anesthesiologist is medically directing two to four concurrent anesthesia procedures.

5. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: ASA physical status modifier P3 describes a patient with severe systemic disease.

6. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: The total units are calculated by adding the base units (5) and time units (60 minutes ÷ 15 = 4) and multiplying by the conversion factor (25), resulting in 35 units.

7. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Modifier E indicates an emergency situation requiring immediate intervention.

8. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 01967 is used for anesthesia provided for labor and vaginal delivery.

9. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Propofol is widely used for the induction of general anesthesia due to its rapid onset and short duration.

10. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: The placement of an epidural catheter for postoperative pain management can be reported separately if performed after the primary anesthesia service and properly documented.

11. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 01936 is used for anesthesia services provided during procedures to address complications, including hemorrhage.

12. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Continuous ECG monitoring is mandated during anesthesia as part of patient safety protocols.

13. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Conscious sedation allows the patient to remain partially conscious and able to respond to verbal commands while minimizing pain and discomfort.

14. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: ASA P4 indicates severe systemic disease that poses a constant threat to the patient’s life.

15. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: A preoperative anesthesia assessment evaluates the patient’s medical history, current health status, and potential risks associated with anesthesia and surgery.

16. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Regional anesthesia allows faster recovery and reduces systemic effects compared to general anesthesia.

17. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Anesthesia payment formula includes base units, time units (calculated in 15-minute intervals), and modifying units for patient-specific factors.

18. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Modifier QK is used when supervising two to four concurrent anesthesia cases.

19. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Weight-based dosing is critical to ensure safe and effective anesthesia administration for pediatric patients.

20. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Documentation must include the type and duration of anesthesia to ensure compliance and accurate billing.

21. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Critical care services provided outside the anesthesia time period can be reported separately if properly documented.

22. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: The modifier '-E' is used to indicate that the anesthesia services were performed under emergency conditions.

23. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: The total anesthesia time is 50 minutes. Dividing 50 by 15 equals approximately 3.33. Anesthesia time units are rounded up to the nearest whole number, so 4 units should be reported.

24. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: The modifier '-AA' is used to indicate that the anesthesiologist personally performed the anesthesia service.

25. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Epinephrine is often used to treat acute hypotension during anesthesia by increasing heart rate and blood pressure.

26. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Monitored anesthesia care (MAC) typically results in a lower incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting compared to general anesthesia, making it suitable for certain procedures.

27. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: The surgeon's operating time is not considered in the anesthesia payment formula. Payment is calculated based on base units, time units, and any applicable modifiers.

28. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Neonates have an immature thermoregulatory system, making them more susceptible to hypothermia during surgery. This must be carefully managed during anesthesia administration.

29. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Post-dural puncture headache is a common complication of spinal anesthesia resulting from cerebrospinal fluid leakage.

30. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: The start and end times for anesthesia services must be documented as they are crucial for calculating time units in billing.

31. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: ASA P5 indicates a moribund patient who is not expected to survive without the surgical procedure.

32. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: A key goal during general anesthesia is ensuring hemodynamic stability, which includes maintaining appropriate blood pressure and heart rate.

33. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: A pulse oximeter is commonly used to monitor oxygen saturation levels in the blood during anesthesia.

34. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Dantrolene is the drug of choice for treating malignant hyperthermia, a rare but life-threatening complication of general anesthesia.

35. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Obstructive sleep apnea increases the risk of postoperative airway complications. The anesthesiologist should plan for appropriate airway management.

36. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Epidural anesthesia is delivered continuously through a catheter placed near the spinal nerves, providing localized postoperative pain relief.

37. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Succinylcholine can cause hyperkalemia due to its effects on potassium release from cells during muscle depolarization.

38. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: End-tidal CO2 monitoring is essential during general anesthesia to assess ventilation and ensure adequate oxygen exchange.

39. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Critical care services provided by an anesthesiologist during a procedure can be reported separately using the appropriate critical care CPT code.

40. Correct Answer: C

   Explanation: Propofol is preferred because it has anticonvulsant properties and does not lower the seizure threshold like ketamine.

255. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: The femoral artery is the primary landmark for locating the femoral nerve during a femoral nerve block.

256. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Post-dural puncture headache occurs due to cerebrospinal fluid leakage through the dural puncture site, leading to intracranial hypotension.

257. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Capnography, which measures end-tidal CO2, is the most reliable method for confirming proper endotracheal tube placement and detecting esophageal intubation.

258. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Cricoid pressure, also known as Sellick's maneuver, is used to prevent regurgitation and aspiration by compressing the esophagus during mask ventilation.

259. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Bradycardia during induction with sevoflurane is typically managed with the administration of atropine to block parasympathetic stimulation.

260. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: A jaw thrust maneuver moves the tongue forward and can relieve airway obstruction caused by tongue prolapse in sedated patients.

261. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: The first step in addressing low tidal volume alarms is to check for leaks in the anesthesia circuit, as this is a common cause.

262. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Monitoring blood glucose and avoiding hypoglycemia are critical in diabetic patients undergoing surgery to reduce the risk of perioperative complications.

263. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Increasing oxygen flow and ensuring airway patency are the immediate actions to address respiratory distress and improve oxygen saturation.

264. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Neostigmine is a cholinesterase inhibitor that increases acetylcholine levels, effectively reversing the effects of non-depolarizing neuromuscular blockers.

265. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Popliteal sciatic nerve blocks are ideal for providing anesthesia and postoperative pain control for foot and ankle surgeries.

266. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Etomidate is contraindicated in patients with acute porphyria as it can exacerbate the condition by inducing enzymatic pathways involved in porphyrin synthesis.

267. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Meperidine is effective in treating postoperative shivering because it acts on the thermoregulatory centers in the brain to reduce shivering.

268. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Ranitidine is an H2 receptor antagonist used preoperatively to reduce gastric acidity and volume, lowering the risk of aspiration during anesthesia.

269. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: General anesthesia is preferred for cesarean delivery in cases of fetal distress as it allows rapid induction and delivery without delay.

270. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Obesity poses a significant challenge for airway management due to potential difficulty in intubation and ventilation. Preoperative airway assessment is crucial to reduce the risk of complications.

271. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Malignant hyperthermia is a life-threatening condition triggered by certain anesthetic agents, particularly in susceptible individuals, leading to hyperthermia and tachycardia.

272. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: The sciatic nerve is most accessible for a block at the popliteal fossa, where it divides into the tibial and common peroneal nerves.

273. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Fentanyl is preferred for patients with renal impairment because it does not have active metabolites that accumulate and cause toxicity.

274. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Spinal anesthesia involves the injection of anesthetic into the cerebrospinal fluid, which is less likely to result in systemic toxicity compared to other techniques.

275. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Positive pressure ventilation can help break the laryngospasm and restore an open airway. Additional interventions may be required depending on the severity.

276. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Bispectral index monitoring provides an objective measure of the depth of anesthesia based on EEG patterns.

277. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: Meperidine is effective in treating postoperative shivering due to its unique mechanism of action on the shivering center in the hypothalamus.

278. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Etomidate is preferred in patients with cardiovascular instability due to its minimal cardiovascular effects.

279. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Manual in-line stabilization is necessary to prevent movement of the cervical spine during airway management in patients with suspected cervical spine injury.

280. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Flumazenil is a benzodiazepine antagonist and is administered to reverse the sedative effects of benzodiazepines.

281. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Inhalation induction with sevoflurane is commonly preferred for pediatric patients due to its rapid onset and minimal airway irritation.

282. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: A high spinal block can lead to numbness, difficulty breathing, and even respiratory distress due to the anesthetic's effect on the thoracic nerves.

283. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: The oxygen failure safety device ensures that hypoxic gas mixtures are not delivered by shutting off other gases if the oxygen supply fails.

284. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Metoclopramide increases gastric motility and reduces the risk of aspiration in patients with GERD.

285. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Etomidate is commonly used for induction in cardiac surgery due to its ability to maintain hemodynamic stability.

286. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Sugammadex is specifically designed to reverse the effects of rocuronium and vecuronium by encapsulating the molecules.

287. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Cricothyrotomy is often the most effective intervention for securing the airway in patients with severe facial trauma and bleeding.

288. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: The Trendelenburg position tilts the patient with the head lower than the feet, improving venous return and reducing the risk of hypotension during surgery.

289. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Nebulized epinephrine is effective for treating stridor by reducing airway edema and relieving upper airway obstruction.

290. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Phenylephrine is a commonly used vasopressor to stabilize blood pressure during anesthesia-induced hypotension as it specifically targets alpha-adrenergic receptors to increase vascular tone.

291. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: A video laryngoscope provides enhanced visualization of the airway, making it an appropriate choice for patients with a history of difficult intubation.

292. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Spinal anesthesia is effective for lower extremity procedures as it provides profound sensory and motor block below the level of injection.

293. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Applying positive pressure ventilation is the first step to relieve laryngospasm before considering pharmacological or surgical intervention.

294. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Fentanyl is preferred due to its hemodynamic stability and rapid onset of action, making it suitable for patients with cardiovascular concerns.

295. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: The brachial artery serves as a key landmark for identifying nerves in the axilla during an axillary block.

296. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Ondansetron is a selective serotonin receptor antagonist that is commonly used to treat postoperative nausea and vomiting effectively.

297. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Midazolam is widely used as a premedication in pediatric patients due to its anxiolytic and sedative properties.

298. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Atropine is the first-line treatment for bradycardia as it increases heart rate by blocking parasympathetic stimulation.

299. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: A reading of 94% or higher is typically considered acceptable during anesthesia, indicating adequate oxygen saturation levels.

300. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Bupivacaine has a longer duration of action compared to other local anesthetics, making it ideal for prolonged procedures or postoperative analgesia.

301. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: The oxygen analyzer monitors and ensures a constant oxygen concentration in the gas mixture delivered to the patient.

302. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: Electrocardiography (ECG) is critical in detecting myocardial ischemia by monitoring changes in the ST segment and T wave.

303. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Epidural anesthesia is preferred in pregnant patients as it avoids potential risks of general anesthesia and provides effective pain relief during surgery.

304. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Ketamine is avoided in patients with aortic stenosis as it increases myocardial oxygen consumption and may worsen cardiac function.

305. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Methadone is effective for managing pain in opioid-dependent patients due to its prolonged action and ability to reduce cravings.

PRACTICE TEST - CPC EXAM PREP - SURGERY

1. A surgeon performs an excision of a malignant skin lesion measuring 2.5 cm in diameter on the back and also removes additional margins of 0.5 cm. What CPT code should be assigned?
   A) 11603
   B) 11602
   C) 11404
   D) 11402

2. A patient undergoes an open treatment for a displaced femoral neck fracture. Which CPT code should be reported?
   A) 27235
   B) 27236
   C) 27244
   D) 27245

3. A surgeon performs a laparoscopic appendectomy. However, during the procedure, it is discovered that the appendix is normal and the surgeon also performs a diagnostic laparoscopy. What code should be reported?
   A) 44970
   B) 49320
   C) 44979
   D) 44950

4. What CPT code would be used for a coronary artery bypass using two arterial grafts?
   A) 33533
   B) 33534
   C) 33535
   D) 33536

5. A surgeon performs a cystourethroscopy with the insertion of a ureteral stent due to ureteral obstruction. Which CPT code should be reported?
   A) 52332
   B) 52310
   C) 52320
   D) 52005

6. A patient has a benign lesion measuring 1.5 cm removed from the cheek. Which CPT code is appropriate?
   A) 11442
   B) 11441
   C) 11402
   D) 11422

7. A surgeon performs a complete thyroidectomy for a patient with thyroid cancer. What is the correct CPT code?
   A) 60200
   B) 60210
   C) 60220
   D) 60225

8. A patient undergoes a craniotomy for drainage of an epidural hematoma. Which CPT code should be reported?
   A) 61312
   B) 61314
   C) 61320
   D) 61322

   A) 31625
   B) 31622
   C) 31628
   D) 31629

   A) 59510
   B) 59514
   C) 59618
   D) 59520

   B) 34203
   C) 34200
   D) 34202

   D) 27615

305. A patient undergoes endoscopic carpal tunnel release to alleviate severe median nerve compression. Which CPT code should be reported?
   A) 29848
   B) 29846
   C) 64721
   D) 64719

306. A surgeon performs a laparoscopic appendectomy for a ruptured appendix with abscess formation. What is the correct CPT code?
   A) 44960
   B) 44970
   C) 44979
   D) 44955



--- CORRECT ANSWERS AND EXPLANATIONS ---

1. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: The correct CPT code is 11603 because it applies to excision of malignant lesions on the trunk, arms, or legs with a diameter of 2.1 cm to 3.0 cm. Both the lesion size and margins are included in the measurement.

2. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: The correct code is 27236, which describes open treatment of a femoral neck fracture with internal fixation or prosthetic replacement.

3. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: The code 44970 is used for a laparoscopic appendectomy. It should be reported even if the appendix is normal, as the procedure is still completed.

4. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 33534 is used for coronary artery bypass using two arterial grafts. The number of grafts determines the appropriate CPT code.

5. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: The correct code is 52332, which specifies cystourethroscopy with the insertion of a ureteral stent for obstruction.

6. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 11442 applies to excision of a benign lesion on the face, ears, eyelids, nose, lips, or genitalia measuring 1.1 cm to 2.0 cm.

7. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Code 60220 is used for a total thyroidectomy, which is appropriate for the complete removal of the thyroid gland.

8. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: The correct code is 61312, which covers craniotomy for drainage of an epidural hematoma.

9. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 31625 refers to a bronchoscopy with transbronchial biopsy of the lung.

10. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 59514 refers to a cesarean delivery only, without postpartum care.

11. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: The correct code is 34201, which describes thrombectomy of an iliac artery using an open method.

12. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: Code 29827 is specific to arthroscopic surgical repair of a rotator cuff tear.

13. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 66984 applies to extracapsular cataract removal with intraocular lens implantation without complications.

14. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 61796 is used for stereotactic radiosurgery for brain lesions involving one simple cranial lesion.

15. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: The correct code is 38724, which describes a complete lymphadenectomy of the axilla for malignant melanoma.

16. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 55400 refers to vasectomy, which is the surgical procedure for male sterilization.

17. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 58661 is used for laparoscopic surgical removal of ovaries and fallopian tubes.

18. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 32480 refers to a pneumonectomy, which is the removal of a lung.

19. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 47563 is used for laparoscopic cholecystectomy with cholangiography.

20. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Code 25608 is used for open treatment of a distal radial fracture with internal fixation.

21. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 43280 describes laparoscopic Nissen fundoplication, a surgical procedure to treat GERD. Other codes listed are for unrelated procedures, such as diagnostic endoscopy (43235), unlisted laparoscopy (43659), and colectomy (44120).

22. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 50230 specifically refers to a radical nephrectomy, which involves the removal of the entire kidney and surrounding tissue, typically for cancer treatment.

23. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 43644 describes laparoscopic gastric bypass surgery for managing morbid obesity. Other codes listed are for different bariatric or unrelated procedures.

24. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 27634 corresponds to the excision of a deeply located soft tissue tumor in the leg that is larger than 3 cm and located below the fascia.

25. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 58210 specifies a total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy. Other codes describe variations such as without oophorectomy or unrelated procedures.

26. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 44140 describes an open resection of a portion of the colon. Procedures such as 44120 and 44150 refer to different types of colectomy and 44204 is for laparoscopic partial colectomy.

27. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 19303 represents a simple or total mastectomy, which is commonly performed for DCIS. Other codes describe modified radical mastectomy (19307), partial mastectomy (19301), or excision of a breast lesion (19120).

28. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: CPT code 31257 describes endoscopic sinus surgery that includes both ethmoidectomy and maxillary antrostomy. Other codes describe different sinus procedures or single sinus surgeries.

29. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 64721 specifies carpal tunnel release by an open technique. Other codes represent procedures for different nerve decompressions or repairs.

30. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 38120 represents laparoscopic splenectomy. Other codes refer to open splenectomy procedures or partial removal of the spleen.

31. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 43633 describes a total gastrectomy with Roux-en-Y reconstruction. Other codes refer to subtotal gastrectomies or procedures without reconstruction.

32. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 49565 is specific to open repair of a recurrent inguinal hernia. Other codes refer to primary repairs or laparoscopic approaches.

33. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 43282 describes laparoscopic repair of a paraesophageal hiatal hernia. Other codes refer to procedures for GERD or unrelated endoscopic interventions.

34. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 60520 refers to thymectomy performed for conditions such as myasthenia gravis. Other codes represent variations in the approach or scope of the procedure.

35. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 63075 describes excision of an intervertebral disc using an anterior cervical approach. Other codes refer to posterior approaches or cervical spinal fusion.

36. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 29881 is used for arthroscopic partial meniscectomy of either the medial or lateral meniscus. Other codes indicate different types of knee procedures, such as repairs or ligament reconstruction.

37. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 11772 is for excision of a pilonidal cyst that involves extensive complexity. Other codes refer to simpler excision procedures.

38. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 27447 represents total knee arthroplasty, a common procedure for advanced osteoarthritis. Other codes refer to partial replacements or unrelated knee surgeries.

39. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: CPT code 49655 describes laparoscopic repair of a ventral hernia with the use of mesh. Other codes refer to open repairs or unrelated hernia procedures.

40. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 47122 describes a partial hepatectomy for tumor removal. Other codes refer to total hepatectomy or unlisted laparoscopic procedures.

41. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 55866 specifically describes a robotic-assisted laparoscopic prostatectomy procedure for prostate cancer.

42. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Code 38530 is used for excision of deep axillary lymph nodes, commonly performed for suspected malignancy.

43. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 25240 specifies an open excision of a carpal bone, often performed for conditions like severe arthritis.

44. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 44204 describes laparoscopic resection of a portion of the small intestine, commonly performed for Crohn's disease.

45. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 47000 is used for a percutaneous liver biopsy performed under imaging guidance, such as ultrasound.

46. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 27650 describes an open repair of a ruptured Achilles tendon, a procedure often required for complete tears.

47. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: Code 13133 is used for complex repair of a wound on the scalp of 12 cm or greater.

48. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 60650 is specifically used for laparoscopic adrenalectomy procedures for conditions such as adrenal tumors.

49. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 19302 describes partial mastectomy with axillary lymph node dissection, commonly performed for breast cancer.

50. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 33881 is used for endovascular stent placement in the thoracic aorta, typically for conditions such as aneurysms.

51. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 15100 applies to split-thickness skin graft placement for wounds up to 100 square cm, including burns.

52. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 25800 describes wrist arthrodesis performed typically for conditions such as advanced osteoarthritis.

53. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: Code 49202 is used for excision of retroperitoneal tumors exceeding 5 cm in size.

54. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 58140 describes an open abdominal myomectomy procedure for removal of uterine fibroids.

55. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 58672 is used for laparoscopic ligation of ovarian veins, commonly performed for pelvic congestion syndrome.

56. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 19081 is used for a stereotactic breast biopsy performed under ultrasound guidance.

57. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 11772 describes excision of a pilonidal sinus with marsupialization, a procedure for complicated cases.

58. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 58661 describes laparoscopic excision of an ovarian cyst or cysts, typically performed for benign or symptomatic conditions.

59. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: Code 27310 is used for the removal of a foreign body, such as a bullet, from the soft tissue of the leg.

60. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: Code 69511 describes a radical mastoidectomy procedure performed for chronic mastoiditis.

61. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 44960 is used for laparoscopic appendectomy specifically for a ruptured appendix with abscess or generalized peritonitis.

62. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 39200 describes excision or removal of a mediastinal cyst or tumor using an open surgical approach.

63. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 36821 refers to surgical creation of an arteriovenous fistula for hemodialysis access without graft placement.

64. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: CPT code 44227 is used for laparoscopic repair of a small bowel obstruction due to adhesions or other causes.

65. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 42420 specifically describes excision of a parotid gland tumor while preserving the facial nerve.

66. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 19367 describes delayed breast reconstruction using a TRAM flap procedure.

67. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 21407 represents open treatment of a zygomatic fracture requiring internal fixation.

68. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 43775 is used for laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy procedures performed for bariatric surgery.

69. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 31225 describes an endoscopic procedure for decompression related to an orbital fracture.

70. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 21931 is used for excision of a deep subcutaneous soft tissue tumor measuring between 3-5 cm.

71. Correct Answer: D
   Explanation: CPT code 39545 describes open repair of a diaphragmatic hernia with the use of a prosthetic patch.

72. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 58662 is utilized for laparoscopic excision of endometriosis affecting structures such as the bowel.

73. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 36561 refers to percutaneous insertion of a tunneled central venous catheter for long-term access.

74. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 27048 describes radical resection of a sacral tumor with extensive reconstruction beyond simple removal.

75. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 58671 is for laparoscopic division of uterosacral ligaments, often performed for pelvic pain relief.

76. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 50544 describes robotic-assisted laparoscopic pyeloplasty for ureteropelvic junction obstruction.

77. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 43254 describes endoscopic submucosal dissection for excision of lesions in the esophagus.

78. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 48153 is used for laparoscopic pancreaticoduodenectomy, commonly known as the Whipple procedure.

79. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 38572 is used for laparoscopic excision of retroperitoneal lymph nodes for cancer staging.

   Explanation: CPT code 42415 describes open excision or resection of the submandibular gland.

   Explanation: CPT code 38120 is used for a laparoscopic splenectomy, which is the surgical removal of the spleen using a minimally invasive technique.

   Explanation: CPT code 27870 is used for arthrodesis (fusion) of the ankle joint, typically performed to reduce pain or stabilize the joint.

   Explanation: CPT code 58150 describes a total abdominal hysterectomy including removal of the uterus and cervix, as well as bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, removing the ovaries and fallopian tubes.

   Explanation: CPT code 31255 is used to report endoscopic total ethmoidectomy, usually performed to treat chronic sinusitis or other sinus conditions.

124. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 27506 is used for open treatment of a femoral shaft fracture using an intramedullary implant, which includes internal fixation.

125. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 43653 is specific to laparoscopic repair of a perforated peptic ulcer, including the use of an omental patch.

126. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 61750 refers to stereotactic biopsy of a deep brain lesion performed through a burr hole approach.

127. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 55866 is specific to robotic-assisted laparoscopic radical prostatectomy with nerve-sparing technique.

128. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 35102 pertains to open repair of a ruptured abdominal aortic aneurysm with placement of a graft.

129. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 11604 applies to excision of malignant skin lesions measuring 2.1 to 3.0 cm, and CPT code 15240 is specific to full-thickness skin grafts to the arm.

130. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 58561 is appropriate for laparoscopic removal of multiple uterine fibroids larger than 4 cm.

131. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 49255 refers to total omentectomy performed due to metastatic disease.

132. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 38724 is for a radical neck dissection that includes excision of lymph nodes, tissues, and structures such as the internal jugular vein.

133. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 44207 is specific to laparoscopic low anterior resection of the sigmoid colon and rectum with colorectal anastomosis.

134. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 11646 applies to excision of malignant skin lesions measuring 4.1 to 5.0 cm, while CPT code 14060 refers to local flap closure on the face.

135. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 67108 refers to repair of retinal detachment using a pars plana vitrectomy.

136. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 61545 is for excision of a brain tumor located in the posterior fossa via craniotomy.

137. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 43631 is used for laparoscopic partial gastrectomy to remove a gastric tumor.

138. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 32663 refers to VATS lobectomy for removal of a lung lobe due to malignancy.

139. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 49205 specifies extensive excision of a malignant tumor from the retroperitoneal area via open approach.

140. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 52353 applies to endoscopic lithotripsy using laser or other energy sources to treat renal calculi.

141. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 39402 refers to mediastinoscopy with biopsy of mediastinal lymph nodes.

142. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 30420 applies to complex reconstruction of nasal septum and adjacent structures due to trauma.

143. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 66172 specifies trabeculectomy with the use of antimetabolites to treat glaucoma.

144. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 47563 is correct for laparoscopic cholecystectomy with intraoperative cholangiography. Code 47562 includes cholecystectomy without cholangiography, and 47564 is for cholecystectomy with exploration of common bile duct.

145. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 44145 accurately describes partial colectomy with anastomosis and removal of mesenteric lymph nodes, typically done for oncologic purposes.

146. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 27506 is correct for open treatment of a supracondylar femoral fracture with retrograde intramedullary nail fixation. Code 27507 includes additional work for intra-articular fractures.

147. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 60254 represents total thyroidectomy with radical neck dissection. Code 60252 includes thyroidectomy with selective neck dissection, but does not include radical neck dissection.

148. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 50544 is used for robotic-assisted laparoscopic pyeloplasty for ureteropelvic junction obstruction. Code 50545 refers to laparoscopic nephrectomy.

149. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 49656 is correct for laparoscopic repair of a recurrent ventral hernia with mesh placement. The other codes represent different types of hernia repairs or open techniques.

150. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 11404 represents excision of a benign lesion from the trunk measuring 3.1 to 4.0 cm, and 13101 is used for complex closure of such wounds.

151. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 43775 accurately describes laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy. Code 43644 refers to laparoscopic gastric bypass with Roux-en-Y reconstruction.

152. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 48102 is specific for excision of a cystic pancreatic tumor done via open surgical approach. Code 48100 refers to excision of a non-cystic lesion.

153. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 44205 describes laparoscopic resection of the small intestine with anastomosis. Code 44202 is for laparoscopic biopsy, not resection.

154. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 50546 is accurate for laparoscopic removal of a pelvic kidney along with ureterectomy. Code 50545 describes laparoscopic nephrectomy without removal of the ureter.

155. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 23515 specifies open treatment of a clavicular fracture with internal fixation. Codes 23615 and 23650 refer to humeral fractures.

156. Correct Answer: C
   Explanation: CPT code 43280 describes laparoscopic myotomy for esophageal achalasia correction. Code 43279 refers to endoscopic stent placement, which is different.

157. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 11772 is for excision of a pilonidal cyst with extensive or complex wound closure. Code 11770 refers to simple excision.

158. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 59151 is used for laparoscopic removal of a ruptured ectopic pregnancy. Code 59150 applies to unruptured ectopic pregnancies.

159. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 45112 describes open resection of the rectum with colostomy creation. Code 45110 refers to low rectal resection without colostomy.

160. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 29848 is specific for endoscopic carpal tunnel release. Code 64721 is for open release of the carpal tunnel.

161. Correct Answer: B
   Explanation: CPT code 23412 is used for an open rotator cuff repair. Code 23420 refers to an arthroscopic rotator cuff repair.

162. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 61546 describes transsphenoidal hypophysectomy for removal of a pituitary tumor. Code 61548 refers to transnasal procedures.

164. Correct Answer: A
   Explanation: CPT code 39200 describes open excision of a mediastinal tumor. Code 39220 refers to more extensive procedures involving the vascular system.

   Explanation: CPT code 27758 refers to open treatment of a distal tibial fracture, including internal fixation, which aligns with the procedure described.

PRACTICE TEST - CPC EXAM PREP - RADIOLOGY

1. A radiologist performs a CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis with contrast to evaluate abdominal pain. Which CPT code should be reported?
   A) 74176
   B) 74177
   C) 74178
   D) 74170

2. A patient undergoes fluoroscopy for a barium swallow study. Which code should be selected to accurately report this procedure?
   A) 74220
   B) 74230
   C) 74240
   D) 74270

3. An X-ray is performed on the left ankle of a patient following an injury. The radiologist reviews two views of the ankle. Which CPT code is appropriate?
   A) 73600
   B) 73610
   C) 73630
   D) 73650

4. A patient is referred for an MRI of the brain with and without contrast due to potential brain tumor symptoms. Which CPT code is appropriate for this procedure?
   A) 70551
   B) 70552
   C) 70553
   D) 70554

5. A radiologist performs a needle biopsy of the liver under ultrasound guidance. Which CPT codes should be reported?
   A) 47000, 76942
   B) 47100, 77002
   C) 47000, 77012
   D) 47100, 76942

6. When coding for a radiology procedure that was performed on the left side of the body, which modifier should be appended?
   A) RT
   B) LT
   C) 50
   D) 26

7. Which CPT code is appropriate for a complete abdominal ultrasound?
   A) 76700
   B) 76705
   C) 76801
   D) 76856

8. What does the term 'contrast media' refer to in radiology?
   A) A substance used to block radiation
   B) A substance used to enhance imaging details
   C) A method of positioning a patient
   D) A technique used for radiation therapy

9. A patient undergoes a PET scan to detect metastatic cancer. Which CPT code would be appropriate for a whole-body PET scan?
   A) 78811
   B) 78812
   C) 78813
   D) 78814

10. What should be included in radiology documentation to ensure compliance with coding guidelines?
   A) Diagnosis alone
   B) Procedure description and diagnosis
   C) Patient history only
   D) Insurance details

11. Which modifier is used for a radiology procedure that was interpreted by a physician but performed at another facility?
   A) 26
   B) TC
   C) 52
   D) 76

12. A patient presents for a screening mammogram, including CAD (Computer-Aided Detection). Which CPT code is appropriate?
   A) 77055
   B) 77056
   C) 77067
   D) 76092

13. A CT scan of the chest is performed without contrast due to suspected pneumonia. Which CPT code applies?
   A) 71250
   B) 71260
   C) 71270
   D) 71275

14. An ultrasound is used for guidance during a thoracentesis procedure. Which CPT code represents the ultrasound guidance?
   A) 76000
   B) 76942
   C) 77002
   D) 76937

15. A radiologist performs an angiography for the lower extremities via catheter placement. Which CPT code is correct?
   A) 75710
   B) 75716
   C) 75724
   D) 75736
